title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: There are currently no amenities or services available at Fort Washington Park due to the lapse in government funding. There is no vehicular access to the park.

title: Road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village is Temporarily CLOSED
description: The road from Park HQ to Rim Village is currently closed due to the latest winter storm. It is not currently possible to get a lake view by vehicle. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road from HQ to Rim Village Remains CLOSED.', 'id': 'A04AED55-0E2F-474B-96DD-C76EBDC1BEBD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Cades Cove Loop Road will be closed Sunday, Nov. 9 until 11am
description: Cades Cove Loop Road will be closed until approximately 11 a.m. on Sunday, Nov. 9 for the Friends of the Smokies annual Loop Lope footrace. Vehicles without event registration passes will not be permitted past the Townsend Wye until the road reopens. Although registration for this year’s event is full, you can learn more at: https://friendsofthesmokies.org/looplope/

title: Fort Point partially closed due to lapse in federal appropriations
description: Fort Point was previously open in October but has since partially closed. The parking lot, interior of the fort and nearby Long Ave. and Marine Dr. are closed. Restrooms will remain open.

title: Baker Creek Prescribed Fire Area Closure
description: The Baker Creek prescribed burn closure order has been revised/reissued. Baker Creek Road and trailhead and Pole Canyon Road and trailhead have reopened. The closure area is revised to much smaller area between Grey Cliffs Campground and Baker Creek Campground. The connector trail between the two campgrounds remains closed. All other trails have reopened. Grey Cliffs Campground and Baker Creek Campground will remain closed for their regular winter seasonal closure.

title: Upper Fort Mason Roads and Parking Area Closures Fall 2025 - Fall 2026
description: Roads and parking areas at upper Fort Mason will have closures during utilities and seismic retrofit projects. Closures planned Fall 2025 through Fall 2026. Lots will be fenced and used as staging areas for projects occurring at Fort Mason. Signs will be posted in advance of utilities work as project progresses through each area at Fort Mason. Read signs and do not park in posted areas. Vehicles will be towed at owner's expense.

title: Prescribed Burn in Cedar Grove Started on November 3rd - Kings Canyon NP
description: Firefighters started the Cedar West Prescribed Burn on Monday, November 3rd in Kings Canyon National Park. Highway 180 (Cedar Grove Road) will remain open, but visitors can expect temporary closures of minor roads in the western part of Cedar Grove, including: Northside Drive, Cedar Lane, portions of West Side Drive, and River Rd (Motor Nature Trail) on the north side of the Kings River. Smoke impacts are anticipated to be minimal, though visitors may see smoke, fire equipment, and personnel.

title: Winter Season Closures
description: The following regular winter season closures are in place: West Side Road, Cougar Rock Campground and Picnic Area, Paradise Picnic Area, Paradise Valley Road, Stevens Canyon Road, White River Campground, White River Road, Sunrise Road, State Routes 410/Chinook Pass (between Crystal Mountain Blvd. and Morse Creek) and 123/Cayuse Pass (at the park boundary).

title: Road Work November 8 on Rock Creek Parkway
description: National Park service will be performing road work and sanitation North and South bound on the Rock Creek Parkway November 8, 2025 from 07:30 am to 01:00 pm.

title: Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles
description: Most roads are closed to prepare for commercially-guided snowcoach and snowmobile travel during the winter season, which will begin December 15 (weather depending). The road between the North and Northeast entrances is the only road open year-round to regular vehicles.

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closures
description: Portions of the Teton Park Road (Taggart Lake TH to Signal Mt.), Moose-Wilson Road (Granite Canyon TH to Death Canyon Road), and other roads are closed to vehicles. Check the Grand Teton Roads page for the latest seasonal and weather related closures. When free of snow, Teton Park and Moose-Wilson Roads are available for pedestrian use, including walking and biking. After they are snow-covered: skiing, snowshoeing, and walking are allowed.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: The following areas are not currently open or accessible at this time: the Carl Hayden, Escalante, and Bullfrog Visitor Centers, Park HQ, Chains Road, and Wahweap Overlook.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: The following are not currently open or accessible at this time: the Capulin Volcano Visitor Center; motor vehicle access on Volcano Highway to the top parking lot (hiking and biking are allowed); or bathrooms (only vault toilet at Volcano top parking lot via 2 mile hike or bike).

title: Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure
description: Going-to-the-Sun Road is now closed for the season between Avalanche Creek and Logan Pass. Travel on other sections of the road, including for hiker-biker access, may change at any time due to winter weather conditions. Travelers in the area should stay informed about road conditions as they may affect park access.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: The following roads are not currently open or accessible to vehicles at this time: main park road to river batteries (Tour Stop #4), Graves Battery Road and National Cemetery Drive. All roads, trails and park grounds remain open to pedestrian traffic.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: While access to the grounds and trails of Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park is available, the following areas, visitor centers, and facilities are not currently open or accessible at this time: Visitor Center and main parking lot, Memorial Building, and Picnic Area restroom facility at the Birthplace Unit; Knob Creek Tavern and restroom facility at the Boyhood Home Unit at Knob Creek.
park: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

title: Nightly Longmire Gate Closures
description: Regular winter nightly closures of the Longmire gate to Paradise will begin starting October 31. The uphill gate will close each day at 4pm (the downhill gate will close at 5pm). The gate will reopen at 9am the next day if conditions allow. The road may close early or remain closed the entire day due to weather or staffing conditions, as determined by the Winter Road Opening Matrix (choose the "more" link).

title: Old NC 284 is closed from Cataloochee Creek to Cataloochee Valley
description: Old NC 284 is open from Big Creek to Cataloochee creek, however there is no access to Cataloochee Valley via Old NC 284 due to road damage. Visitors may access Cataloochee Valley via Old Cataloochee Turnpike.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Old 284 closed to all traffic near Cataloochee', 'id': 'C7DB457F-58CA-4C25-B7F4-17FA3FF53AD1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Park Headquarters Road closed
description: Park Headquarters Road is closed due to rehabilitation work on the Sugarlands water and wastewater systems. The Gatlinburg Trail is open. Visitors can access this trail from Gatlinburg or the Sugarlands Visitor Center.

title: Cunard Road Closure
description: Cunard Road is closed through the winter due to ongoing construction. The closure is just beyond the Brooklyn Miner Trail and both the Brooklyn Miner and the Kaymoor trail remain open. The closure is expected to last until the end of March. Check back for updates.
park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the Season
description: The North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are now CLOSED for the season. They will not reopen until mid to late June or July 2026.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the Season', 'id': '3AB12B2F-7C46-4EFF-BF4B-B431F4FB2C81', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Quarry Exhibit Hall Temporary Closure
description: The Quarry Exhibit Hall "Wall of Bones" is temporarily closed for a major road, parking lot, and sidewalk construction project. There will be no visitor access to the fossils in the quarry when closed.

title: Closed areas
description: Due to a lapse in appropriations, the following park areas are closed: •Parkway Headquarters •Turkey Run Park •South Turkey Run Area •Fort Marcy •Great Falls Park •Clara Barton National Historic Site •Theodore Roosevelt Island and Parking Lot •Arlington House (The Robert E. Lee Memorial) and associated facilities •Gravelly Point •Roaches Run •Jones Point Park Parking Lot and Restroom •Collingwood Picnic Areas •Riverside Park •Fort Hunt Park

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: The following are not currently open or accessible at this time: the Rincon Mountain Visitor Center, the Rincon Mountain District Entrance Road/Cactus Forest Loop Drive is not open to vehicle traffic. All other park areas are open.

title: South Shore Quinault Road Closed Outside of Park Boundary
description: South Shore Road – which is maintained by Jefferson County – is closed due to a major wash-out. The North Fork Trailhead and Campground can be reached via N Shore Rd.

title: Hurricane Ridge Rd will close at 5:00pm on 10/17/25
description: The Hurricane Ridge Road will close at 5:00pm on 10/17/25 due to incoming winter weather.

title: Temporary bridge on North Shore Quinault Rd to be removed on 10/23/25
description: Olympic National Park crews will remove a temporary bridge on the North Shore Quinault Road on October 23, 2025 for the winter. The temporary bridge will likely not withstand winter weather conditions. The Graves Creek area will be inaccessible to vehicle traffic due to the bridge removal and South Shore Rd closure. See alert.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: The following are not currently open or accessible at this time: Fort Clatsop Visitor Center and parking area. Fort Clatsop Replica and parking area. Netul Landing and parking area. Fort to Sea Trail will remain open. Visitors should be aware that while some services are unavailable visitors are expected to protect park resources by following all regulations and “Leave No Trace” practices.
park: Lewis and Clark National Historical Park

title: Road Closures May Be in Effect
description: Weather patterns in October and November may cause the park road to close temporarily due to snow. Alerts may not be updated in a timely manner due to the lapse in appropriations. Please check local weather forecasts and plan accordingly when considering a trip to Lassen in the fall.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: There are currently no amenities or services available due to the lapse in government funding. All buildings/facilities/public restrooms including the tour road, parking lots beyond the main gate, and visitor center are closed.

title: What to Expect During Government Funding Lapse
description: There are currently no amenities or services available due to the lapse in government funding. All buildings/facilities/public restrooms are closed including the visitor center and headquarters parking lots.

title: Hilina Pali and Mauna Loa Road Closed to Vehicles
description: Hilina Pali Road (at Mauna Iki Trail) and Mauna Loa Road (at Kīpukapuaulu) are temporarily closed to vehicles due to high fire danger; hiking and bicycling are permitted

title: The following are not currently accessible at this time:
description: The visitor center and restrooms are closed. The main tour road, visitor center parking lot, Redoubt Brannan, McFadden Farm/Tour Stop 6, and Stones River National Cemetery are closed to vehicles.

title: Delays on Wawona Road (continuation of Highway 41)
description: Expect delays on Wawona Road between Yosemite Valley and Wawona from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 4:30 pm until approximately mid-November.

title: National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians
description: Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.

title: Louisiana Circle Closed
description: Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.

title: Medano Pass Primitive Road Impassible to Most Vehicles at Crossing Two
description: Driving the Medano Primitive Road is NOT ADVISED at this time. Erosion and deep mud near the second creek crossing are making the road impassible to most vehicles. There have been many instances the area is blocked by a stuck vehicle. All vehicle operators will be responsible for their own vehicle recovery and could incur significant expense from third party towing/recovery operators.
park: Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve

title: Cascade River Road Closure due to Road Conditions
description: Cascade River Road is closed to vehicles at milepost 20 (Eldorado parking lot) three miles before the trailhead. Foot and bicycle traffic is permitted beyond the gate.

title: Kenilworth Aquatic Gardens Parking Lot Closed until December 31, 2025
description: Kenilworth Aquatic Gardens main entrance and parking lot will remain closed until December 31, 2025, at 11:59 pm. Visitors may enter through the gate at Anacostia Ave NE and Douglas St NE. Street parking is available.

title: Oct 3-5: Temporary Lane Closure on Rock Creek and Potomac Parkway
description: From Friday, Oct. 3 at 8 pm until Sunday, Oct. 5 at 8 pm, the right southbound lane of Rock Creek and Potomac Parkway will be closed between P Street NW and Pennsylvania Avenue NW to allow DC Water to conduct repair work.

title: Access to Big South Fork’s Scenic O&W Road Blocked Due to Bridge Failure
description: Road access to O&W Road was blocked by order of the State of Tennessee Department of Transportation. Pine Creek Bridge was closed by the state because it was deemed unsafe. The closed bridge is the first bridge on O&W Road after the Toomey Road intersection. The closed bridge is outside of the boundary of the Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area.
park: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: Road Closures
description: River Road East is open from the eastern end to the Glenn Spring Road junction. Glenn Spring Road is open. The paved road between Castolon and Santa Elena Canyon (Park Route 16) is open. River Road is closed west of the Glenn Springs Road junction. Old Ore Road, Hot Springs Road, and Black Gap Road are all closed. Unpaved roads require 4-wheel drive. Your safety is your responsibility, be prepared to self-rescue.

title: Use Caution Kelso Dunes Road
description: Flooding has resulted in damage to Kelso Dunes Road. Watch for numerous washouts with dirt, rocks, potholes, debris and sharp shoulder drop-offs. Use caution when driving and watch for road crews at work.

title: Temple Bar Road Down to One Lane at Several Wash Crossings
description: Due to a storm on 9/26/25 the road was flooded at several wash crossings. The road has reopened but is down to one lane in several places. Use caution where rocks are still in the road and areas that work crews are present.

title: Dyer Road Closed Due to Road Construction
description: Road closures/construction will continue on the east section of Dyer Road, between Glenn-Kelly and LaFayette Roads, and will extend onto the west portion of Dyer Road, between Glenn-Kelly and Chickamauga-Vittetoe Roads. During the closures, all public traffic, including motorists, equestrians, pedestrians and bicyclists, is prohibited from using the closed sections.
park: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park

title: Intermitent Road Work
description: Visitors should be aware that there is road work occurring in the park starting August 12th and potentially continuing through November. There may be some minor delays and alternative parking arrangements.

title: Park Closures Due to Wildfires
description: As of 9/24/2025: South Rim Road and visitor center have reopened. East Portal Road is open. North Rim is open. South Rim Campground, East Portal Campground, and some trails remain closed. Do not enter closed or burned areas until further notice.
park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Many Roads Closed due to Flooding
description: Badwater Road, North Highway, and some other roads are still closed due to damage by flash floods on 9/19/2025. Click "More" for a full list of closures.

title: Tree Thinning Project Will Cause Short Delays Starting September 28, 2025
description: Expect one-way traffic with short delays along Highways 87 and 385 while contractors remove pine saplings to improve visibility and safety along roadways. A pilot car will lead vehicles through the project area. The project begins on Sunday, September 28, and continues until complete.

title: Tree Maintenance Along Southern Section of the GWMP
description: Beginning September 22, the NPS will conduct tree maintenance along the GWMP between Mount Vernon and just south of Alexandria. To safely complete this work, temporary single-lane closures will be required in both directions. At times, short segments of the parkway may experience brief, periodic directional closures.

title: El Calderon Trail closed for  Facilities & National Capital Parks - East Headquarters,NACE,Extension of temporary closure prohibiting the public from entering the area around the USPP Anacostia Operations Facility
description: and National Capital Parks – East Headquarters through 11:59 pm Wednesday
relatedRoadEvents: 2025. Access through Aviation Drive SE entrances and the metro access gate into Anacostia Park willconstruction August 11
region: The El Calderon Trail and parking area are closed from August 11, 2025, through late May 2026 for a major improvement project. NPS Road 100 will remain open for local traffic only, and the Continental Divide Trail will remain open for CDT thru-hikers.

title: Public Access Closure around USPP be closed."
Public Access Closure around USPP Facilities & National Capital Parks - East Headquarters
description: Extension of temporary closure prohibiting the public from entering the area around the USPP Anacostia Operations Facility, USPP Aviation Facility, and National Capital Parks – East Headquarters through 11:59 pm Wednesday, December 31, 2025. Access through Aviation Drive SE entrances and the metro access gate into Anacostia Park will be closed.

title: South Parking Lot of Greenbelt Park Closed to Vehicle Access
description: The south parking lot of Greenbelt Park will be closed to vehicle access until December 31, 2025, at 11:59 p.m. The area will remain available to pedestrians.

title: Pavement Preservation Project- Playalina District Beginning 9/22/25
description: Playalinda Beach District will begin a Federal Highways pavement preservation project on Sept. 22nd, 2025. Visitors to the seashore should expect limited access to some parking areas and roadways to include the vistas

title: West and East Border Roads closed for public safety
description: All border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.

title: Use caution on Essex and Black Canyon Roads
description: Flooding has resulted in damage to Essex and Black Canyon roads. Watch for numerous washouts with dirt, rocks, and debris. Use caution when driving and watch for road crews at work.

title: 9/19/2025 Update - Parkway and Campground closed from MP 181-204.
description: The parkway is closed to all traffic from MP 181-204. This includes Jeff Busby Campground at MP 193.1. Follow the signed detour to travel around the closure. Construction is anticipated to continue through October.

title: Illinois Memorial Closed for Restoration
description: The memorial itself is closed for restoration starting on September 16, 2025. The parking area is partially closed. Parking spaces are open to allow access to Tour Stop 2/Shirley House. Tour Stop 3/3rd Louisiana Redan is open. The Tour Road is open.

title: Dingmans Falls Trail, Road, and Access Closed for Bridge Replacement
description: Dingmans Falls site is closed for a bridge replacement project and trail rehabilitation. All traffic, including pedestrian, cyclist, and vehicle traffic, is prohibited on the road and trail during construction.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: A Few Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage
description: These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events and/or repairs to roadway damage: Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Crystal Cave Rd
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road Closures Related to Road Damage From and/or Repairs Of Past Storm Events', 'id': 'EF614A2C-8A9A-4188-AED2-768723DD55A3', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2025
description: Reds Meadow Road is tentatively open until October 6, 2025. The road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, are only open Saturdays and Sundays.

title: Raceway Bridge Closed For Preservation
description: The Raceway Bridge is being replaced through mid-November. Please use Roosevelt Avenue entrances to access the park.

title: Rialto Beach - Mora Road Repair Will Require Single-Lane Traffic, Up to 20-minute Delays
description: Starting on September 9, crews will stabilize and repair Mora Road - the road to Rialto Beach. The work will require single-lane traffic through the 0.25-mile work zone and may result in 20-minute delays.

title: Road Construction Continues on a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield
description: The Brotherton Road closure, between Alexander's Bridge and LaFayette Roads, remains in effect as rehabilitation continues. During the closure, all public traffic is prohibited from using the closed section.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Closure of a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield', 'id': '2447DCCC-35CB-487A-9E1D-ABD719B80885', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/chch/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]
park: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park

title: Portions of Stilesboro Rd. Closed Starting on Monday, September 8, 2025
description: Beginning on Monday, September 8, Stilesboro Rd. will be closed from Gilbert Road and Old Mountain Road to the park's Visitor Center entrance due to Cobb County utility work. The park's Visitor Center will only be accessible via Old Highway 41.

title: Playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area Closed
description: The park is improving accessibility at the playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area. During construction, until approximately the end of December 2025, the playground is closed and 10 nearby parking spaces will be used for construction vehicles only.

title: SR 165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge is closed: no access to Carbon River or Mowich Lake.
description: There is NO public access to Carbon River & Mowich Lake from SR 165. The bridge is closed to pedestrians, bicycles and vehicles and there is no alternate route.

title: Picnic Area Closed Periodically
description: The road up to the picnic area and picnic area may be temporarily closed. Please be careful if going there. Please use caution when hiking near the closed areas. Please report any trees that you find down, and do not climb over or under fallen trees

title: Tour Road Closed South of Route 36 at the Eastern Front
description: The Tour Road south of Route 36 is closed to vehicles at the Eastern Front. Scheduled maintenance begins. Walkers and bicyclists must follow signs for detours around construction areas.

title: Difficult Conditions Complicate Cataract Canyon Takeouts
description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

title: Paving on Crater Road (Route 378)
description: Paving has begun on the road to the Summit District. Work will be done in sections between Mile Post 0 in Kula and Haleakalā entrance through October. Expect delays and leave extra time Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: Peavine Road Closed
description: Peavine Road near Big Spring will be closed for paving beginning 7/28 at noon and will remain closed for several weeks. Please use Highway 103 to reach all destinations in the Big Spring area.

title: Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road
description: Sunflower Road is closed at Big Sandy Creek for bridge replacement. Big Sandy Trail is open and accessible via Sunflower Road from Dallardsville.

title: Ongoing Road Repair on Main Road
description: Ongoing road work will be taking place throughout the Main Road on the island. Expect potentially heavier vehicle traffic and areas of uneven terrain. Please yield to construction traffic.

title: Extended Mt. Auburn Street and Sparks Street Closure
description: Local road closures and detours on Mount Auburn Street and Sparks Street, and a lane closure on Memorial Drive, may affect traffic and directions to the site. Please observe posted detour and traffic change signs.
park: Longfellow House-Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site

title: Green River Ferry Temporarily Closed
description: The Green River Ferry is temporarily closed for several months while repairs are made to its navigational system and support towers which sustained extensive damage during flooding in April 2025.

title: Expect large crowds and high traffic volume on weekends
description: Big crowds and high traffic volume may cause the main parking lot on Shoreline Drive to fill and close for short periods of time. Check park social media channels for the latest updates.

title: Elevated Fire Risks - Full Closure (Vehicle and Foot Traffic) in Prone Areas
description: Drought conditions pose risk of fire. The following areas are closed to vehicle and foot traffic until further notice: Coastal Road between lighthouse and Boom Site/Kalawao cattleguards; settlement perimeter road along fence, roads through fuel farm.

title: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road closed.
description: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road (Heintooga Round-Bottom Road) are closed. The 9-mile paved section of Balsam Mountain Road remains open; visitors may still access Balsam Mountain Campground.

title: 2025 RANGER III Parking Area Construction Notice: Carpool When Possible
description: Houghton city will be doing construction work that affects the upper, non-gated lot for most of the 2025 summer season. Parking may become limited in the NPS available lots. To help with available parking, when possible, please carpool.

title: Mainland Parking Lot Closure June 2
description: The mainland parking lot will be closed as of June 2 for rehab and improvements. For more information please see the press release.

title: Tour Road Closed
description: Due to safety hazards caused by tornado damage, the Tour Road is open up to Tour Stop 2, but no further, and the Nature Trail is closed. The Visitor Center is now open.

title: Major Road Closure in Corinth, MS
description: ALERT - Major Road Closure in Corinth, Mississippi. A major bridge replacement has begun on North Polk Street in Corinth, MS, and motorists will need to seek other routes. The work is not estimated to be completed until July or August 2026.

title: Possible Delays on Old Mine Road due to Van Campens bridge repairs
description: Due to a bridge repair project over the Van Campens Brook, visitors on Old Mine Road may encounter delays over Summer 2025. The road will remain open, with single-lane traffic during working hours.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Main Street Walpack Bridge Closed Until Further Notice
description: Main Street in Walpack Center is closed at the Flatbrook Bridge due to structural damage to the bridge.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Parking Lot Closure
description: Due to ongoing construction, the parking lot is closed. Ample street parking can be found along Dudley Street, including the Brookline Reservoir. For accessible parking, please visit our "Contact Us" page for more information.
park: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site

title: Road Closure and Fishing Pier Impact
description: The Engineer Wharf, one of two fishing piers at Fort Monroe is temporarily closed. The Finger Pier remains open. Also closed is the section of Fenwick Road between Ingalls and the East Gate of the fort. Detour signs will aid travelers around the closure.

title: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle Closed for Repairs
description: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle are closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic for repairs. Entering these construction areas is prohibited. This work is to repair severe weather damage in 2020. The remainder of the park and tour road are open.

title: Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025
description: The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.

title: U.S. Navy Blue Angels Practices
description: On Tuesdays and Wednesdays from April to October, parking lots at Fort Pickens Area fill early. Vehicles parked in non-designated spots are subject to citation and towing. When lots are full, the area will close to incoming traffic. Plan ahead.

title: Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Sat & Sun IF parking is full, entrance closes, no entrance until parking available.
description: Saturdays & Sundays with good weather, IF our parking lots fill we close the park entrance. (Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr) We re-open when parking is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Site Access
description: Be aware in your planning that I-40 in NC and I-26 in TN have been compromised due to the effects of Hurricane Helene. In addition, the Erwin Hwy (107) bridge leading into Greeneville was destroyed and is not expected to reopen until sometime in 2025.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping
description: Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice
description: The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.

title: South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available
description: In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

title: Park Closures
description: From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.

title: Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area
description: Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.

title: Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only
description: High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.

title: South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28
description: Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.

title: County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday
description: County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.

title: Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide
description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

title: Monsoon Season & Flash Floods
description: Heavy rains can cause sudden flooding, especially in canyons and washes. Do not drive or hike through flood waters. Get to high ground and wait for floods to subside. Some roads may close temporarily; closures are posted at the visitor center.

title: High Crowds & Park Capacity
description: High visitation may require limiting access to Bear Gulch and other parking areas in the park. If all parking lots reach capacity, incoming traffic will not pass the campground until space is available. This occurs most often between 8a and 3p on weekends
